blocks.name: mrcflem
blocks.content: The domain and range of the function expression for Moore closures. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm mrcflem(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wf(cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), cpw(c1), c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  fmpttd(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), c0, wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)))
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c1))), wcel(cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), c0), wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wss(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), c0), wne(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), emptycls))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c1)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c1))), wss(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), c0))
  ssrab2(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  ne0d(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), c1, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c1))))
  elrabd(s1, c1, c0, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c1))), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(cv(s0), c1))
  sseq2(cv(s1), c1, cv(s0))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c1)), wcel(c1, c0))
  mre1cl(c0, c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c1)), wss(cv(s0), c1))
  elpwi(cv(s0), c1)
  mreintcl(c0, c1, crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cfv(cmre, c1))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cmre, c1)
  diff.cmre.s(s0)
  diff.wss.s(s1, cv(s0), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

  ssrab2(s1, c0, s0 âŠ† s1)
  ne0d({ s1 âˆˆ c0 | s0 âŠ† s1 }, c1, (c0 âˆˆ(Moore ` c1)âˆ§ s0 âˆˆ P(c1)))
  elrabd(s1, c1, c0, (c0 âˆˆ(Moore ` c1)âˆ§ s0 âˆˆ P(c1)), s0 âŠ† s1, s0 âŠ† c1)
  sseq2(s1, c1, s0)
  adantr(c0 âˆˆ(Moore ` c1), s0 âˆˆ P(c1), c1 âˆˆ c0)
  mre1cl(c0, c1)
  adantl(c0 âˆˆ(Moore ` c1), s0 âˆˆ P(c1), s0 âŠ† c1)
  elpwi(s0, c1)
  mreintcl(c0, c1, { s1 âˆˆ c0 | s0 âŠ† s1 })
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, (Moore ` c1))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cmre, c1)
  diff.cmre.s(s0)
  diff.wss.s(s1, s0, c1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: fnmrc
blocks.content: Moore-closure is a well-behaved function. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm fnmrc() {
  |- wfn(cmrc, cuni(crn(cmre)))
} = {
  mprg(hs1, cuni(crn(cmre)), wfn(cmrc, cuni(crn(cmre))), wcel(cmpt(hs0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cint(crab(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))), universe))
  fnmpt(hs1, cuni(crn(cmre)), cmpt(hs0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cint(crab(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))), universe, cmrc)
  df-mrc(hs1, hs0, hs2)
  sylbi(wcel(cv(hs1), cuni(crn(cmre))), wcel(cmpt(hs0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cint(crab(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))), universe), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cmre, cuni(cv(hs1)))))
  mreunirn(cv(hs1))
  sylancl(wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cmre, cuni(cv(hs1)))), wcel(cmpt(hs0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cint(crab(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))), universe), wss(cmpt(hs0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cint(crab(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))), cxp(cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cv(hs1))), wcel(cxp(cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cv(hs1)), universe))
  syl(wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cmre, cuni(cv(hs1)))), wss(cmpt(hs0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cint(crab(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))), cxp(cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cv(hs1))), wf(cmpt(hs0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cint(crab(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))), cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cv(hs1)))
  mrcflem(hs0, hs2, cv(hs1), cuni(cv(hs1)))
  fssxp(cmpt(hs0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cint(crab(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))), cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cv(hs1))
  xpex(cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cv(hs1))
  pwex(cuni(cv(hs1)))
  vuniex(hs1)
  vex(hs1)
  ssexg(cmpt(hs0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cint(crab(hs2, cv(hs1), wss(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))), cxp(cpw(cuni(cv(hs1))), cv(hs1)), universe)
  diff.hs1.c(cuni(crn(cmre)))
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(hs1))
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(cv(hs1)))
  diff.hs2.c(cv(hs1))
  diff.hs2.c(cuni(cv(hs1)))
}

blocks.name: mrcfval
blocks.content: Value of the function expression for the Moore closure. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm mrcfval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wceq(c2, cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cmrc, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wceq(c2, cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))), diffsc(s0, c2))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wceq(c2, cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))), diffsc(s1, c1))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wceq(c2, cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))), diffsc(s1, c2))
  syl5eq(c2, cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), cfv(cmrc, c0), wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)))
  eqtrd(cfv(cmrc, c0), cmpt(s0, cpw(c1), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(c0)), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)), wceq(cfv(cmrc, c0), cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(c0)), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))), wcel(c0, cuni(crn(cmre))))
  sseli(c0, cfv(cmre, c1), cuni(crn(cmre)))
  fvssunirn(cmre, c1)
  fvmpt3(hs0, c0, cuni(crn(cmre)), cmrc, cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(c0)), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cint(crab(s1, cv(hs0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), universe)
  mpteq12dv(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cint(crab(s1, cv(hs0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), cpw(cuni(c0)), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  pweqd(cuni(cv(hs0)), cuni(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  unieq(cv(hs0), c0)
  inteqd(crab(s1, cv(hs0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  rabeq(s1, cv(hs0), c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  df-mrc(hs0, s0, s1)
  sylancl(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(cmre))), wcel(cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cint(crab(s1, cv(hs0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), universe), wss(cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cint(crab(s1, cv(hs0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), cxp(cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cv(hs0))), wcel(cxp(cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)), universe))
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(cmre))), wss(cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cint(crab(s1, cv(hs0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), cxp(cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cv(hs0))), wf(cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cint(crab(s1, cv(hs0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)))
  sylbi(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(crn(cmre))), wf(cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cint(crab(s1, cv(hs0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cmre, cuni(cv(hs0)))))
  mreunirn(cv(hs0))
  mrcflem(s0, s1, cv(hs0), cuni(cv(hs0)))
  fssxp(cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cint(crab(s1, cv(hs0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cv(hs0))
  xpex(cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cv(hs0))
  pwex(cuni(cv(hs0)))
  vuniex(hs0)
  vex(hs0)
  ssexg(cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cint(crab(s1, cv(hs0), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), cxp(cpw(cuni(cv(hs0))), cv(hs0)), universe)
  mpteq1d(s0, cpw(cuni(c0)), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), cpw(c1), wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)))
  pweqd(cuni(c0), c1, wcel(c0, cfv(cmre, c1)))
  mreuni(c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(crn(cmre)))
  diff.hs0.c(cmpt(s0, cpw(cuni(c0)), cint(crab(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cuni.s(s0, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cuni.s(s1, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, cuni(c0))
  diff.cuni.s(s0, c0)
  diff.cpw.s(s0, c1)
}

blocks.name: mrcssid
blocks.content: The closure of a set is a superset. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: mrcidb2
blocks.content: A set is closed iff it contains its closure. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: mrcidm
blocks.content: The closure operation is idempotent. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: mrcsscl
blocks.content: The closure is the minimal closed set; any closed set which contains the generators is a superset of the closure. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 31-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: mrcssvd
blocks.content: The Moore closure of a set is a subset of the base. Deduction form of ~ mrcssv . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)

blocks.name: mrcssd
blocks.content: Moore closure preserves subset ordering. Deduction form of ~ mrcss . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)

blocks.name: mrcssidd
blocks.content: A set is contained in its Moore closure. Deduction form of ~ mrcssid . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)

blocks.name: mrcidmd
blocks.content: Moore closure is idempotent. Deduction form of ~ mrcidm . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)

blocks.name: mressmrcd
blocks.content: In a Moore system, if a set is between another set and its closure, the two sets have the same closure. Deduction form. (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm mressmrcd(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cfv(cmre, c4)))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cmrc, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c1, cfv(c0, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c2, c1))
} = {
  eqssd(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, c2), w0)
  sseqtrd(cfv(c0, c1), cfv(c0, c2), cfv(c0, cfv(c0, c2)), w0)
  mrcssd(c0, c1, cfv(c0, c2), c3, c4, w0)
  mrcidmd(c0, c2, c3, c4, w0)
  sstrd(c2, c4, c1, w0)
  mrcssd(c0, c2, c1, c3, c4, w0)
  sstrd(c1, c4, cfv(c0, c2), w0)
  mrcssvd(c0, c2, c4, c3, w0)
}

  âŠ¢ (w0 â†’(c0 ` c1)=(c0 ` c2))
  âŠ£ (w0 â†’ c3 âˆˆ(Moore ` c4))
  âŠ£ c0 =(mrCls ` c3)
  âŠ£ (w0 â†’ c1 âŠ†(c0 ` c2))
  âŠ£ (w0 â†’ c2 âŠ† c1)
} = {
  eqssd((c0 ` c1), (c0 ` c2), w0)
  sseqtrd((c0 ` c1), (c0 ` c2), (c0 `(c0 ` c2)), w0)

blocks.name: submrc
blocks.content: In a closure system which is cut off above some level, closures below that level act as normal. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 9-Mar-2015.)
